body:
Since you're a copy paster I won't evaluate your code nor tell you about best practices and so on. This would be a waste of both our times :)

Instead I'll just tell you which lines to copy paste to make this thing work, regardless of how many - (downvotes) people will give me for it :P

So, you have these two lines:

<input type="text" name="amount" value="1" size="1" /><br />
<input type="text" name="timelimit" value="0" size="1" />

Cut those out and replace them with the following:

<input type="hidden" name="amount" value="1" size="1" /><br />
<input type="hidden" name="timelimit" value="0" size="1" />

Now for your last element you want to hide you only specify:

The final one is a plain text or html text radio buttons.

Based on this I can't really tell which one's you'd like to hide. I'm assuming you're talking about these:

<input type="radio" name="contenttype" value="" /> 
<input type="radio" name="contenttype" value="html" checked />

Which would have to be replaced with:

<input type="hidden" name="contenttype" value="" /> 
<input type="hidden" name="contenttype" value="html" checked />

Enjoy the copy pasting and have a nice day :)
title: hide a text field in html form
